intro: Pterocephalus coulteri, commonly known as Coulter's pterocephalus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, feathery foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along canyon walls. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
